articles.title: Metformin induces AMPK activation and inhibits mTOR signaling in breast cancer cells
articles.abstract: Preclinical studies demonstrate that metformin activates AMP-activated protein kinase (AMPK), leading to downstream inhibition of mTOR and reduced proliferation in breast cancer cell lines. Synergy with chemotherapy observed in vitro.

articles.title: Population analysis of metformin use and reduced cancer incidence
articles.abstract: Epidemiological studies show an association between metformin use and lower incidence of several cancers, though confounding by indication and metabolic health remains a concern.

articles.title: Metabolic reprogramming by metformin in colorectal adenomas
articles.abstract: Clinical biomarker studies show metformin reduces insulin and IGF-1 pathway activity and may decrease adenoma recurrence in hyperinsulinemic patients.

articles.title: Aspirin's dual role in cardiovascular protection and cancer prevention
articles.abstract: Low-dose aspirin inhibits COX-1 mediated platelet aggregation while also modulating inflammatory pathways implicated in carcinogenesis. Long-term use shows protective effects against colorectal cancer.

articles.title: Mechanisms of aspirin resistance in cardiovascular patients
articles.abstract: Genetic polymorphisms in COX-1 and drug metabolism enzymes contribute to variable aspirin response. Platelet function testing may guide personalized antiplatelet therapy approaches.

articles.title: Sildenafil's nitric oxide pathway modulation in pulmonary hypertension
articles.abstract: Sildenafil inhibits phosphodiesterase-5, enhancing cGMP signaling and promoting pulmonary vasodilation. Clinical studies demonstrate improved exercise capacity and hemodynamics in PAH patients.

articles.title: Unexpected cardiac benefits of sildenafil in heart failure
articles.abstract: Preclinical studies suggest sildenafil may improve diastolic function through cGMP-mediated mechanisms. However, clinical trials in heart failure with preserved ejection fraction showed mixed results.

articles.title: Thalidomide's immunomodulatory effects in multiple myeloma
articles.abstract: Thalidomide demonstrates anti-angiogenic and immunomodulatory properties through TNF-alpha inhibition and T-cell co-stimulation. Combination with conventional chemotherapy improves outcomes in myeloma patients.

articles.title: Teratogenicity mechanisms and modern applications of thalidomide
articles.abstract: Understanding of thalidomide's teratogenic mechanisms led to strict prescribing protocols. Modern applications in oncology and inflammatory diseases capitalize on its unique immunomodulatory properties.

articles.title: Hydroxychloroquine's lysosomal effects in autoimmune diseases
articles.abstract: Hydroxychloroquine accumulates in lysosomes, altering pH and interfering with antigen processing. This mechanism underlies its efficacy in rheumatoid arthritis and lupus treatment.

articles.title: Antimalarial drugs as autophagy modulators in cancer therapy
articles.abstract: Hydroxychloroquine and chloroquine inhibit autophagy, a cellular recycling process often dysregulated in cancer. Clinical trials investigate their potential as cancer therapy sensitizers.

articles.title: Minoxidil's potassium channel activation and hair growth mechanisms
articles.abstract: Minoxidil opens ATP-sensitive potassium channels, promoting vasodilation and nutrient delivery to hair follicles. Topical application stimulates anagen phase transition and hair shaft diameter increase.

articles.title: Systemic effects of topical minoxidil: cardiovascular considerations
articles.abstract: While topical minoxidil has minimal systemic absorption, case reports describe cardiovascular effects in sensitive individuals. Monitoring recommended in patients with pre-existing cardiac conditions.

articles.title: Drug repurposing strategies in pharmaceutical innovation
articles.abstract: Systematic approaches to drug repurposing include computational screening, phenotypic profiling, and network-based methods. Successful examples demonstrate reduced development timelines and costs.

articles.title: Machine learning approaches to identify drug repurposing opportunities
articles.abstract: AI-driven analysis of genomic, proteomic, and clinical data reveals novel therapeutic applications for existing drugs. Integration of multiple data types improves prediction accuracy for successful repurposing.
